alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Coastal Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Jim Hogg; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 23 at 1:50PM CDT until March 24 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Elevated to Critical Fire Weather Danger Thursday... .Very low humidity is forecast Thursday with very dry air mass over Deep South Texas. Relative humidity to fall well below 20 percent for much of the region. Also, 20-foot winds are forecast between 10 to 20 mph Thursday afternoon. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM CDT THURSDAY FOR STRONG WINDS, VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND ABUNDANT CURED FUELS FOR PORTIONS OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS... The National Weather Service in Brownsville has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 10 AM to 8 PM CDT Thursday. * AFFECTED AREAS...Zapata, Jim Hogg, Brooks, Inland Kenedy, Coastal Kenedy, Starr, Southern Hidalgo, Northern Hidalgo, Inland Willacy, Coastal Willacy, Inland Cameron, and Coastal Cameron Counties. * TIMING...10 AM CDT to 8 PM CDT. * WIND...20-foot Northwest winds 10 to 20 MPH. * HUMIDITY...Between 8 to 20 percent for all of Deep South Texas except 15 to 25 percent for Coastal Cameron, Willacy and Kenedy counties. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means critical fire weather conditions are occurring now...or will shortly. In general...these conditions include sustained 20 foot winds of 25 MPH or greater...humidity ranging from below 25 percent in Zapata County to below 45 percent along the coast...each lasting for 2 hours or longer... and cured fuels. Humidity below 25 percent in most areas will trigger fire danger at lower wind speeds. Detailed decision tables are found at HTTP://WEATHER.GOV/RGV/?N=MAPCOLORS#FIRE.
